name: Newport Beach Hotel and Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I give this hotel three stars because it is average--good in some areas, lacking in others.
reviews.title: You don't get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positives - we had a beach view, which was lovely. The location is very close to the cliff walk and the downtown attractions, but you aren't caught in the middle of the Thames St. bachelorette party hell. We stayed in the older building - the room was fine. Not great, not horrible. The pool and rooftop firepit in the newer building were nice. The front desk staff was very helpful with getting us cabs or explaining how to get to the local sites.
reviews.title: Couldn't stay where I wanted to stay.

reviews.text: The negatives - no free parking. Really? I'm spending over $400 a night for an average room and you don't include parking? The food in the restaurant was fine, but the service was nearly absent. We had to wait forever for a simple egg sandwich in the morning. They weren't even that busy. Perhaps they were waiting for the chicken to lay some eggs, but at least freshen my coffee while I'm waiting 40 minutes for eggs.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: If this hotel were $150 a night I would give it a higher rating, but for this exorbitant price, you really don't get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Perfect location, comfortable stay!

reviews.text: We go to the Newport Folk Festival every year. Bought tickets for the festival and waited a few weeks to book a room and alas the inn we usually stay at was booked. We picked the Newport Beach hotel as our best alternative as we like to stay in the Middletown beach area. My first impression was the odor in the hotel lobby. Couldn't figure it out. The lobby is clean and modern but the odor confused me. Stayed in the historic hotel on the fourth floor..a corner room with a glimpse of the ocean...one queen bed. The room is small but with a nice flat panel TV, refridgerator, coffee maker, CD-DVR player. The size of the bathroom was generous. The room was clean, no odor like the lobby, and quiet...we were even next to the elevator. Had breakfast in the restaurant on the first floor all three days and the food and service was exceptional. The room was pricey and there was a surcharge of $38.00 to park for three nights. The parking fee pissed me off since I paid $1087.00 for 3 nights. Didn't go to the pool or fitness center because we were out at the festival all day. For the price..I wouldn't go back here. Will try to book somewhere up the street on the hill.Half the price will pay for some great meals.
reviews.title: Got less than expected for the price....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always visit Newport several times a year from New York CIty. We normally stay in town but summers are difficult depending on the day or if there is a festival. We always get a suite at this property but they were sold out. We reluctantly agreed to an old building room with no view. Not good. Way too small for two adults. We will stick with the suite next time.
reviews.title: Old building must be avoided. Great Restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try the restaurant. Lyle is the Chef and owner. Our special place at Newport. The salmon is fantastic.
reviews.title: Nice time !!

reviews.text: We had a lovely time !!! We went during the heat wave in July and had to warm up the room a bit because the a/c was over the top !!! I was afraid that since we were in the older section, the a/c wouldnt be up to par, but we found just the opposite. We heard the guests next door arriving one evening, but it was in the later part of the evening and most of the hotel was quiet.....but never heard them again........had an opportunity to eat in their restaurant which was great !!! Loved the fact that it was across from the beach and out of the "busyness" of Newport itself.......but close enough to easily enjoy the downtown. Definitely would recommend to friends and definitely will return in the future.
reviews.title: If you must

reviews.text: Beware - restaurant doesn't belong to hotel and uses 'cheats' to get tips out of you. Adds non deductible 18 % then says you should know it will be added! (++) on set menu.
reviews.title: Did not honor reservation or request for handicap accessibility

reviews.text: Rooms in old building very poor, noisy and small.
reviews.title: Great Little Getaway

reviews.text: Picked up a last minute discounted 1 bedroom in the suites building for a 3 night stay. The prices before the discount are a bit steep, but given it's proximity to be expected. Check in is at 4, which is already on the later side and at 4 the room still wasn't ready. Not sure what the delay was, but they ended up putting us in another 1 bedroom which was. This wasn't offered initially as an option until I mentioned the check in time as the room they gave us was still a standard 1 bedroom with a pond side view. The room itself was great, clean and as expected when looking at their website. The hotel is right across from First beach and a short walk. The beach itself is nice but the red seaweed can be a bit of a problem at certain spots on the beach. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience and we will be looking to return for another visit. If we can find another discounted rate, that would make it an easier sell.
reviews.title: Good Hotel & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've visited Newport Beach Hotel and suites two years in a row for 4th of July. The newer renovated building has beautiful rooms. The bathrooms are luxurious and most have water views. We got a 2 bedroom suite this year, and there were three couples, plenty of space. The girls at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is also a hop away from Atlantic Beach Club and Easton beach, the hot spots for the 4th of July. If the main part of your visit is for the manions and shops and restaurants of Thames, you may be better off at a hotel closer to that area, but we were fine with taking a cheap cab down to the bars. It was very nice to wake up and just walk across the street to get on the beach and cliff walk.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you want to be near the beach.

reviews.text: My only real complaint is that you have to pay for parking. When rooms are over $700 a night, to add on another $12/day/car for parking is just plain rude. Especially since the lot was never full. Despite the parking, I will probably look to return next year!
reviews.title: This hotel is a historical dump!!!

reviews.text: We stayed in the older building and it was hideous. When I think historical hotel I assume it would be grand. This was just an old dump. Our shower did not drain. The ice maker shook the floor. The restaurant held minimal hours. Traffic to get in and out on the main road was atrocious. The area in general was not at all what we expected. Overall, this place was worth around $30 per night not $300 per night. Keep looking and DO NOT stay here.
reviews.title: SO glad we found this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in the old building which is a bit dated but all clean and tidy and it does have a bit of an oldey worldey atmosphere we arrived just after midday and were able to check in, staff friendly and polite . our room seemed tad cramped with a large kinsize bed taking up most of the room also had all usual things ie fridge tv coffee maker etc and a microwave, the bathrroom was as big as the room with bath shower etc all clean and tidy. we were at the back of the building overlooking lake but only had a small window, didnt use pool or hot tub but again looked clean and tidy. hotel is just across the road from beach but is about a 40min walk to Newport but there are a few resturants locally. Had to pay for car parking which i wasnt expecting but other than that no problems
reviews.title: No Problems
Spend the extra money and stay in the new rooms!
reviews.text: Even though the hotel is not in downtown Newport, it is in a great location. Directly across the street from "First" beach so you don't have to pay for parking. They supply the towels for the beach. The new building is secure where you must have a key to get in. Parking is easy with some covered and some not but I never had any trouble finding a spot. There is an indoor pool and hot tub and an outdoor hot tub on the roof. The new building is across the street from the front desk, restaurant and historic building but its not horrible and a quick walk.
I work in a hotel, so I am probably biased and more picky than the average guest. With that said...here are my goods and bads.
reviews.title: OK for what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: Full kitchen including utensils, plates, cookware, dishwasher, stove, oven and fridge. We were given an upgrade to a corner suite when we arrived and it was the size of our New York apartments! King sized beds and Juliette balconies. Marble bathrooms. Powerful shower heads. Flat screen TVs with DirecTv. Complimentary wifi. Starbucks coffee in the restaurant and rooms. Washer and dryer in suite. Safes in the closets. Views of the beach.
reviews.title: Nice for the beach but not what we were expecting

reviews.text: The bad (needs work): the iHome clock radios are not able to be seen at night. You can't tell what time it is! Even though the drapes have blackout curtains, they don't "blackout" the bright sun at 5:30am in the summer. My sheets had a stain on them when I arrived but I called and had them changed prior to sleeping on them. The bathroom counter was not cleaned for the entire 3 days we were here. Washcloths were used, taken from the room and not replenished with new cloths. One of the overhead lights was burned out the entire time. When we arrived, there were a few flies in the rooms. I opened up the doors and guided them out but didn't get one or two. The pillows are down feather and not very comfortable. The beds are hard which are fine with me but my aunt didn't like them. The kitchen doesn't have any paper products like napkins or paper towels so spills have to be cleaned up with bath towels. The guest services books were never re-stacked each day and left scattered on the coffee table.
reviews.title: Must Stay When Visiting Newport

description: Located along the sandy beach of one of the most famous resort destinations, the Newport Beach Hotel and Suites stands as the freshest face of Newport. With its meticulously restored gambrel-style historic hotel and contemporary shingle addition, this seaside resort combines historic charm with contemporary sophistication. The original hotel completed a multi-million dollar restoration and the new suites addition, adjacent to the original hotel, features the largest and most luxurious guest rooms in Newport County.
